result.execSummary:
The defendant Fletcher Barnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court by 10/31/2023.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as indicated by DOC.
Defendant shall pay restitution, if any, to Clerk of Courts by 10/31/2023. Maximum amount is $250.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Fletcher Barnes in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Fletcher Barnes. State recommends 3 years probation, consecutive to current sentence, court costs, counseling, DNA, restitution up to $250. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Zaleski heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 3 years probation, consecutive, with conditions: assessment, treatment, counseling; DNA; restitution up to $250, if requested; court costs to be paid by 10/31/2023. No credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Fletcher Barnes appeared by video, in custody of WSPF, Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Fletcher Barnes, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Per Atty Zaleski, defendant waives right to prelim. Court reviews rights and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to prelim hearing. Court finds probable cause to bind over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Fletcher Barnes appeared by video in custody of WSPF, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State does not request bond. Defendant's release date is 10-25-2022. Court sets status as to counsel.
Initial appearance on January 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
